EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.98}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.01}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Land on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Land on the x-axis is {0.83}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Mortgages on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Mortgages on the x-axis is {0.98}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Affordability on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Affordability on the y-axis is {0.45}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Industrial on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Industrial on the x-axis is {0.38}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Property Management and Condition or the cell corresponding to Property Management and Market Trends?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Property Management} and {Market Trends} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Residential and Age or the cell corresponding to Commercial and Supply?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Commercial} and {Supply} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Property Management and Inventory or the cell corresponding to Residential and Supply?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Residential} and {Supply} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.42 to 0.45?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Land, Age), (Construction, Interest Rates), (Land, Supply)}.
